name: Fluvoxamine Maleate

indications.text: fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( ssri ) indicated treatment obsessive compulsive disorder ( ocd ) ( 1 ) . efficacy demonstrated : one 12-week study fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules adults ( 14.1 ) . two 10-week immediate-release ( ir ) fluvoxamine tablets adults one 10-week study ir fluvoxamine tablets children adolescents ( 14.1 , 14.3 ) . one maintenance study ir fluvoxamine tablets ( 14.2 ) .

contraindications.text: adults : recommended starting dose 100 mg bedtime , weekly increases 50 mg tolerated maximum effect , exceed 300 mg/day ( 2.1 ) . pediatric patients naïve fluvoxamine maleate : lowest available dose fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules may appropriate ( 2.2 ) . hepatically impaired : decreased clearance may require modified dose titration ( 2.3 ) . extended treatment : adjust dose maintain lowest effective dose ; reassess patients periodically ( 2.4 ) . discontinuation : gradual dose reduction recommended ( 2.7 , [ 5.10 ] ) .

adverseReactions: coadministration thioridazine , tizanidine , pimozide , alosetron , ramelteon fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules contraindicated ( [ 5.4 5.8 ] ) .
indications_original: Fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules are a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) indicated for the treatment of obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) ( 1 ). Efficacy was demonstrated in: One 12-week study with fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules in adults ( 14.1 ). Two 10-week studies with immediate-release (IR) fluvoxamine tablets in adults and one 10-week study with IR fluvoxamine tablets in children and adolescents ( 14.1 , 14.3 ). One maintenance study with IR fluvoxamine tablets ( 14.2 ).
contraindications_original: Adults: Recommended starting dose is 100 mg at bedtime, with weekly increases of 50 mg as tolerated to maximum effect, not to exceed 300 mg/day ( 2.1 ). Pediatric patients naïve to fluvoxamine maleate: The lowest available dose of fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules may not be appropriate ( 2.2 ). Hepatically impaired: Decreased clearance may require modified dose and titration ( 2.3 ). Extended treatment: Adjust dose to maintain lowest effective dose; reassess patients periodically ( 2.4 ). Discontinuation: Gradual dose reduction is recommended ( 2.7 , see Warnings and Precautions [5.10] ).
adverseReactions_original: Coadministration of thioridazine, tizanidine, pimozide, alosetron, or ramelteon with fluvoxamine maleate extended-release capsules is contraindicated (see Warnings and Precautions [5.4 to 5.8]).
